meanings.definition: The act of applying starch to fabric to stiffen it.
meanings.sent1: After the laundry, the crispness of the shirt was due to the starching.
meanings.sent2: The tailor recommended starching the collar for a sharper look.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat played with the box of starching powder, leaving a trail of white paw prints.
meanings.sent4: The starching of the curtains transformed them into rigid sheets that blocked out the sunlight.
meanings.sent5: Grandma's secret to perfectly ironed clothes was the careful starching she did every Sunday.

meanings.definition: The process of treating food with starch to thicken it.
meanings.sent1: The chef used starching to make the sauce thicker and more flavorful.
meanings.sent2: Mom's special recipe included starching the gravy for a rich texture.
meanings.sent3: The food critic joked that the restaurant's excessive starching turned the soup into a pudding.
meanings.sent4: The starching of the soup gave it a hearty consistency that warmed the diners' hearts.
meanings.sent5: The magic of starching transformed the watery broth into a velvety delight.

meanings.definition: The act of adding starch to water to make it more viscous.
meanings.sent1: The scientist observed the starching of the liquid under the microscope.
meanings.sent2: The recipe called for starching the mixture to achieve the desired thickness.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched the starching turn the water into a gooey mess.
meanings.sent4: The sudden starching of the solution caught the chemist by surprise.
meanings.sent5: The experiment failed due to the incorrect timing of the starching process.
